title: Missing Security Headers (CSP, X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, HSTS)
description: The application does not set important security headers on its HTTP responses. Missing headers include: Content-Security-Policy (CSP), X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, and Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS). These headers provide defense-in-depth protection against various web attacks including clickjacking, MIME sniffing, XSS, and protocol downgrade attacks.
impact: 1. Without X-Frame-Options: Application is vulnerable to clickjacking attacks where an attacker could frame the application and trick users into clicking malicious elements. 2. Without X-Content-Type-Options: Browser could MIME-sniff responses and execute scripts (XSS). 3. Without CSP: No defense against XSS attacks at the policy level. 4. Without HSTS: Session cookies could be stolen via protocol downgrade attacks if used over HTTP.
evidence:
POC execution confirmed all 4 critical security headers are missing from HTTP responses:

Response headers from http://localhost:8082/dashboard:
- cache-control: public, max-age=0
- connection: Keep-Alive
- content-encoding: gzip
- content-type: text/html; charset=utf-8
- date: Fri, 07 Nov 2025 16:39:15 GMT
- server: Apache/2.4.65 (Debian)

POC Output:
========== SECURITY HEADERS CHECK ==========
[笨余 MISSING: Content-Security-Policy
[笨余 MISSING: X-Frame-Options
[笨余 MISSING: X-Content-Type-Options
[笨余 MISSING: Strict-Transport-Security

Total Required Headers: 4
Missing Headers: 4

VULNERABILITY CONFIRMED: Application is missing 4 critical security headers
remediation: 1. Add X-Frame-Options: DENY (or SAMEORIGIN if framing is needed) - prevents clickjacking attacks. 2. Add X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff - prevents MIME sniffing attacks. 3. Add Content-Security-Policy header with appropriate directives (e.g., default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline') - prevents XSS attacks. 4. Add Strict-Transport-Security header (e.g., Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains) - forces HTTPS connections. 5. Configure these headers in Apache configuration file (/etc/apache2/apache2.conf or virtual host config) or in the application framework (Django, Flask, etc.). Example Apache configuration: Header set X-Frame-Options "DENY", Header set X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff", Header set Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'", Header set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains"
references: OWASP: Missing Security Headers, CWE-1021 (Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers), CWE-693 (Protection Mechanism Failure), CWE-345 (Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity)
